bodyPatterns.matches: .*"content":"What is the cultural significance of the Day of the Dead in Mexico.*

choices.text: The Day of the Dead (DÃ­a de los Muertos) is a Mexican holiday celebrated on November 1st and 2nd to honor and remember deceased loved ones. It is a blend of indigenous and Catholic traditions, featuring vibrant altars (ofrendas), marigold flowers, sugar skulls, and parades. The holiday reflects a view of death as a natural part of life and a time for family and community gatherings.
